key_points: Dustin Diamond, famous for playing Screech on 'Saved by the Bell', died at 44 after a battle with lung cancer.
Diamond was diagnosed with Stage 4 small cell carcinoma less than a month before his death.
He began chemotherapy shortly after his diagnosis but the cancer spread rapidly.
Diamond was a part of 'Saved by the Bell' for its entire run from 1989 to 1993 and appeared in several spinoffs.
Relations with his castmates soured after he released an unflattering tell-all book in 2009, though he later made amends.
He revealed that his 2006 sex tape used a stuntman and his face was added digitally.
Diamond had minor roles in movies and appearances on reality and quiz shows after 'Saved by the Bell'.
He discussed the challenges of being a child star, noting the loss of a normal childhood.
Diamond was not part of the 'Saved by the Bell' revival on Peacock in 2020.
Co-stars Mario Lopez and Tiffani Thiessen expressed their condolences and reflected on the fragility of life following his death.
